summary: bibliometric review of the scientific production, geographical distribution, collaboration, impact, and subject area focus of pneumonia research indexed on the Web of Science over a 15-year period. the most productive country was the USA (38.49%), followed by the UK (7.18%) and Japan (5.46%). research production from China increased by more than 1000%. top 30 countries ranked according to according to population index, GDP index, GNI per capita index, R&D expenditure index and researchers in R&D index. top 30 journals with the highest number of pneumonia articles published in 2001–2015, citations, citation rate (CR), impact factors for the year 2015. top 15 journals producing the most research on pneumonia, plus citation rates.
